nodes.text: The tintolive tree was a species of spirate-leaved tree that grew on the Core World of Chandrila. Multiple square kilometers of tintolive forest grew on the foothills located in Chandrila's Gladean State Parks. In 26 ABY, the Jedi Jaina Solo attempted to avoid fellow Jedi Kyp Durron because she believed that Durron would ask her to be his wingmate. Ultimately, Durron was able to find Solo, a fact that the latter ascertained when she saw Durron through the leaves of a group of tintolive trees on a Chandrilan hillside.

Tintolive trees first appeared in Greg Keyes's 2001 novel The New Jedi Order: Edge of Victory II: Rebirth, the second volume of the Edge of Victory Duology, which was itself a part of the series Star Wars: The New Jedi Order.
